text.0: The NEJM Race and Medicine topic page features a selection of NEJM articles on race and medicine with implications for improving patient care, professional training, research, and public health. All articles assembled on the page are freely available.
text.1: In a randomized trial comparing ventilation with a cuffless laryngeal mask airway to a face mask in neonates with asphyxia, the laryngeal mask airway was not superior to the face mask with respect to early neonatal death and moderate-to-severe hypoxic–ischemic encephalopathy.
text.2: Free Access: NEJM Covid-19 Articles and Resources. #COVID19 #SARSCoV2
text.3: Fear of discrimination by life insurance companies has been an obstacle to progress in the use of genetic technologies in medicine and research. A new Florida law will allow residents to undergo genetic testing without fear of the financial consequences of results.
text.4: In this audio interview conducted on November 25, 2020, the editors look at new studies of disease transmission in closed environments and provide updates on convalescent plasma and hydroxychloroquine. #COVID19 #SARSCoV2
